c087c7d0-c4ef-406a-812c-9d26596a6833.description: Earners have accessed an online document with audio which shows how everyone is a stress container. The earner has listened to the audio and watched the video to understand different types of stress and helpful and unhelpful coping mechanisms.
c087c7d0-c4ef-406a-812c-9d26596a6833.name: How to understand your stress bucket (2 of 8)

issuer.summary: issued by Cambridge City Council and authorized by Badge Nation

alignments.name: Cities of Learning Badging Standard- Engage Layer
alignments.description: This badge has been mapped to the Engage Layer of the Cities of Learning Badging Standard. The earner understands what's expected of them and is able to acquire information by actively experiencing learning.

badge_template_activities.title: The Earner of this badge has learnt about the causes of stress and how each individual is a stress container. The Earner has also learnt, reflected upon and understood what their stresses are and what they do when they are stressed and has gained an understanding of their own stress levels. Earners have learnt about helpful and unhelpful coping mechanisms and have been assessed through three questions.

By watching the video, the earner has learnt how to recognise the elements in their own lives which can contribute to stress. They have reflected and looked at how they can use self control and self discipline and how they can adapt their behaviours and thinking before the elements collect to cause stress.

The earner has engaged with the video by answering the ongoing questions posed throughout the delivery. From this they have understood what are good coping methods and bad coping strategies. They have looked at their own lives and evaluated how the deal with the stresses in their own experience and self evaluated how they could have worked through the situation differently. They have also gained go to coping strategies and recommendations on how to avoid bad coping strategies.

The earner has engaged in a survey to look at their approach to stress. By doing this they have achieved an extended level of personal awareness, recognised where their stresses lies and have been able to put together new coping strategies to help with their personal stress management in order to assist their wellbeing going forward.
This badge is open to all (Open)
The Loft, 5a Fishers Yard, St Neots, Cambs PE19 2AG

badge_template_activities.title: Earner has researched the eligibility requirements needed to successfully complete the Police Constable application, recruitment, and assessment process.
Earner has successfully completed and submitted the application form.
Earner has demonstrated the willingness to further educate themselves in a professional setting.
Earner has completed GCSE Maths and English at a minimum of grade C or 4 (or equivalent qualification, such as level 2 functional skills in Maths and English).
Earner has two A Level passes (or equivalent) consisting of 32 UCAS points or at least one year's employment in a role with comparable skills to policing or academic study.
Applicant is at least 17 years of age and has not received a rejection to the Police Constable application at a date less than 6 months previous.
This badge is open to all (Open)

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have learnt about how to stay safe in their accommodation by participating in facilitated talks and activities. Examples include; how to make the accommodation secure, using and testing alarm systems, and monitoring treating living conditions such as black mould.

Earners have learnt about how to stay safe in their local living environment by participating in facilitated talks and activities. Examples include; Identifying sources for help and support, knowing what to do in the event of flooding, a fire, or where to report a crime.
By application, please contact the provider for more information
WEA, 4 Luke Street, London, EC2A 4XW

endorsements.description: City and Guilds endorse the Cities of Learning Badging Standard designed as a scaffold to recognise knowledge, skills and behaviour achievement developed in association with the RSA

b432bcad-c8b2-4ece-917d-1d9f173ba761.description: Earners of this badge have completed a 5 week course on tenancy rights and responsibilities.
b432bcad-c8b2-4ece-917d-1d9f173ba761.name: Understanding Tenancy Agreements - Why Don't They Teach This in School (course completion)

alignments.name: Cities of Learning Badging Standard - Participate Layer
alignments.description: This badge has been mapped to the Participation Layer of the Cities of Learning Badging Standard. The earner has met expectations, can interact with learning and is able to join in with others.

f6893501-80d1-4d2d-8e15-3bd78b0a0930.description: Earners of this badge have explored the Fitzwilliam Museum’s collections and taken part in creative activities to find enjoyment and improved wellbeing.

alignments.description: This badge has been mapped to the Participation Layer of the Cities of Learning Badging Standard. The earner has met expectations, can interact with learning and is able to join in with others.

badge_template_activities.title: Earner has shown curiosity in exploring the Fitzwilliam Museum’s collections. They have shown self-awareness, self-reflection and sensitivity through developing and communicating their responses to objects and artworks.
Earner has demonstrated creativity through taking part in art activities inspired by the Fitzwilliam Museum’s collections, exploring their potential to improve wellbeing.
This badge is only available to Students, Members or Employees (Closed)
Fitzwilliam Museum, Trumpington Street, Cambridge, CB2 1RB
